result.execSummary:
The defendant Derek Kyle Nelson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Cash Bond previously posted in the amount of $500.00 has been applied.  The remaining balance of the  Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.  The AODA already completed is to be acknowledged by the Supervising Agent, however, the Agent must be satisfied that this requirement has been completed satisfactorily by the Defendant prior to sentencing.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

miscConds.notes: Same repayment provisions apply as noted above for Count No. 1.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Reminder notice returned: Return to Sender, Attempted Not Known, Unable to Forward.  se

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Case Called @ 3:02 PM: Defendant Derek Kyle Nelson in court with attorney Caroline Ann Carver.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Resolution recited by ADA with argued terms on sentencing recommendation.  Def and counsel concur with State's recital.    Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  No impairment on proceeding today.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea Ct 1 (POT):  NC   Plea Ct 3 BJump:  NC  Court accepts plea and enters JOC.  Ct 2 DRI.  Argument by ADA.  Argument by Atty Carver - argues for lesser period of supervision due to Winnebago Co matter.  Statement by Def's Mother prior to sentencing. Statement by Def:  Yes. The Court:  Applauds rehabilitation efforts undertaken thus far.  S/W - 18 mos probation - concurrent to any existing supervision - Conditions:  Already completed AODA to be acknowledged by Supervising Agent however, Agent must be satisfied that AODA efforts already completed have been completed satisfactorily by his efforts;  the defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician; No objection to be supervised in home county; Court Costs - 60 DTP or PP;  DNA Sample/Surcharge Assessed.    Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice. Appeal Rights Given. No opportunity for expungement ordered.

Case Called @ 2:10 PM: Defendant Derek Kyle Nelson in court with attorney Caroline Ann Carver.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.    NGP received and entered.   Per DA:  Offered extended to counsel with discovery being exchanged.  STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Status conference scheduled for October 23, 2015 at 02:55 pm.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars - no taverns, bars or any other facility whose main purpose is serving alcohol, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

Case Called @ 12:00 Noon: Defendant Derek Kyle Nelson in court with attorney Colleen Bradley, both appearing via video from WCJ.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.   ADA argues as to $500 Cash Bond w/conditions.   SPD notes special appearance and argues as to Signature Bond in light of current programming.  The Court:  Modest flight risk and failure to abide by terms of current bond in another jurisdiction.  Orders bond of $500 Cash Bond w/conditions as requested.  INIT Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Initial appearance scheduled for September 22, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
